definition: to resist/to ward off/to hold one's own/to receive guests
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: The little one could stand it no longer. His nose twitching, he burst out crying.
sentences.chinese: 小毛頭招架不住了，鼻子一抽，哇地一聲哭起來。

sentences.english: By now the number of the attacks in the city was making it almost impossible for the police to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 截至目前，襲擊次數之多幾乎使警方無力招架。

sentences.english: This makes misses, dodges and parries a lot less painful.
sentences.chinese: 這使得未命中，躲閃，招架不那麼讓人痛苦。

sentences.english: It cannot be dodged, blocked or parried , and costs 10 runic power (for now).
sentences.chinese: 他不能被躲閃，招架，格擋，消耗10符文能量。

sentences.english: It cannot be dodged, blocked or parried , and costs 10 runic power (for now). Think Heroic Overrevenge.
sentences.chinese: 他不能被躲閃，招架，格擋，消耗10符文能量。

sentences.english: Authors are totally powerless in the face of reviewers.
sentences.chinese: 作家完全無力招架評論家。

sentences.english: He was, she believes, unusually susceptible to women.
sentences.chinese: 她認爲他對女人毫無招架之力。

sentences.english: Dual Wield now also allows you to parry frontal melee attacks.
sentences.chinese: 雙武器現在也可以讓你招架前方的近戰攻擊。

sentences.english: Ezra was a very difficult baby.
sentences.chinese: 埃茲拉是位令人難以招架的孩子。

sentences.english: I'm such a sucker for romance.
sentences.chinese: 我對浪漫毫無招架之力。

sentences.english: The work has overwhelmed them a bit.
sentences.chinese: 這份工作讓他們有點招架不住了。

sentences.english: The exertion that that wench acts in pettish is severe, I also ordinarily can not sustain the blows.
sentences.chinese: 那丫頭撒嬌的功夫是厲害，朕也經常招架不住的。

sentences.english: Too many students losing some of the reforms will.
sentences.chinese: 過多的改革會讓學生招架不住。

sentences.english: True, these are give away chips the other side doesn't expect to win, but that's not the point.
sentences.chinese: 的確，你會虛晃用的籌碼，讓對方招架不住，但這。

sentences.english: Too many emotions cause us to control incapable.
sentences.chinese: 太多的情感使我們無力招架。

definition: to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
to make a move (in martial arts or figuratively)
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
attack from two sides/pincer movement/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
to jump out of the way
to batter/combo (hit) (gaming)/(volleyball, table tennis etc) double hit/double contact
